description: Working well in Arch but won't open in Neon at the moment.
Application Does not open in Neon at all..

Somehow, the state of calendars in general is really sad. The only FOSS todo/calendar apps that actually have a decent amount of features to be usable apart from just 'what event will happen when' are KDE apps.
Kalendar does the job well, with a good UI by default.

Doesn't open in neon at the moment, but I was excited enough for it that I compiled from source.

I've seen Kalendar in action on YouTube from the developer and I'm so excited to try this out for myself. It looks like the best calendar app out there. 

Except, I can't get it to open in KDE Neon. Oh well. I'll wait some more until it's working. 

I have a feeling it's going to be a five-star app. And the only reason for the one-star is that it doesn't open at all on KDE Neon.
summary: Patiently waiting for this. Does not open in Neon

description: Unfortunately, cannot start in KDE Neon
This is an amazing calendar app. I love the sleek, modern interface. The week view is especially usefull.
Have been using it for a while and its an awesome application

The application is beautiful, but the syncing is terrible.

I have it set up to sync with Nextcloud and if I update any task in Kalendar it doesn't sync back to NC. Heck, it doesn't even sync between the week view and the tasks view!

The tasks.org Android app works perfectly, so it's not a problem with NC.
GREAT APP!! but sadly error prone

I could not get this version of Kalendar to work with my basic Google account, however, I could get Kalendar to work by installing via apt install kalendar in terminal. The terminal installed version works but this one does not with the latest version of KDE Neon.
summary: Version Does Not Work with Google

description: I have no complaints, works and looks exactly how I expect from a calendar app.
Please make it optional to choose which day starts the week. It is quite annoying to have Sunday as the default.
does not open in kde neon

Has 2 dependencies that are needed to operate correctly (devs are aware)

qml-module-org-kde-kirigami-addons-labs-mobileform
qml-module-org-kde-kirigami-addons-datetime
The app launches fine, but doesn't seem to have the ability to add appointments to the calendar. You create an appointment and save it, but it never appears. So basically of no use.

Looking great 
but I'm unable to access my caldavs from Nextcloud.
I'm waiting for the next Kalendar version.

Kaleandar has a nice clean interface to my calendars. I am able to see my nextcloud caldav calendar in it. The trick is to add the interface through Kontact. You follow the wizard and then the calendars show up in both locations. Adding and editing appointmetnts work and it shows the calenadars in an easy-to-read format. 

It's a much easier to navigate caleandar program than the KDE PIM calendar or Thunderbird/Lightning. Most of the issues I've seen are minor nits that I'm sure will be improved in the future. For example, when you edit the start time of an event it inserts new characters rather than overwriting characters.
Was hoping that this calendar app would be a replacement for korganizer. Sadly this app will lose entries when editing and it crashes a lot. Not ready for prime time.

Poor application, can't set reminders, if you somehow manage to set, it doesn't remind you. Doesn't have a widget or anything that helps integrate with the clock or some other calendar thingy - one should not keep the app open in order to be reminded of events.

Kalendar looks good on the surface, and for the most part, does what's supposed to. However, I was stuck with two calendars out of the box, "Birthdays and anniversaries" and "Personal". I cfouldn't a way to add any more local. All I could do was change the color of the calendar events. I couldfn't create any more colors to indicate the catetgories I use. Gnome is much better for customization.
No way to sync iOS calendars.
Does exactly what it is supposed to do. Can importing iCal files, clear and sleek interface. 4 Stars because you cannot subscribe to web calendars.
Fails to launch on Fedora 39.
Unfortunate that this doesn't work when it comes from the kde team.
looks realy nice and promosing, but start fails quick and very silent on kde neon
As per subject, reproducibly fails on startup and segfaults
It is very nice to finally see such a beautiful and thought after application for all my Calendar needs!
Which means no usable CalDAV support.
Erst mega. Dann auf allen Geräten Fehlermeldung beim Eintragen von Terminen: Invalid parent collection
Das Programm ist völlig funktionslos. Keines der Menüpunkte ist mit einer Funktion hinterlegt. Ein komplettes Fake.

Schöner kleiner einfacher kalender, den man einfach mit Kde und google konto verbinden kann. Finde den nicht schlecht als gegenüber den standart KDE Organizer. Würde mich freuen wen noch erweiterung verpasst wird.
No se puede utilizar, los menús están completamente corruptos y sin texto
mejor que la antigua
Tiene bastantes funcionalidades que me permiten organizar mi dia.

Trabajo con Neon KDE Plasma. Se alineó enseguida con mi cuenta de GMail configurada en el sistema.
Tuve que señalar, eso si, los calendarios y grupos de tareas para visibilizarlos. Pero además de eso, nada más.

Hasta ahora todo bien.
Une étoile obligatoire, allez pour l'icone. Installée sur un bureau plasma sous kde neon, cette application ne s'ouvre pas du tout.
